instruction: How does the proposed machine-learning method using the deep belief network (DBN) and support vector machine (SVM) compare to traditional methods in terms of improving the prediction accuracy of dynamic non-invasive blood glucose concentrations?
Output: The proposed machine-learning method using the deep belief network (DBN) and support vector machine (SVM) outperforms traditional methods in terms of improving the prediction accuracy of dynamic non-invasive blood glucose concentrations. The past study found that when the DBN-based high-dimensional deep features were used, the root mean square error of the SVM model was reduced by 71.67%. Additionally, the correlation coefficient (R (2)) and the P value of the Clark grid analysis (P) were increased by 13.99% and 6.28%, respectively.
